com.github.i49.hibiscus.schema

Interface BooleanType

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AtomicType, JsonType

    public interface BooleanType
extends AtomicType
    One of built-in types representing JSON boolean which has TypeId.BOOLEAN as a type identifier.

    An instance of this type can be created through SchemaComponents.bool().

    
 import static com.github.i49.hibiscus.schema.SchemaComponents.*;
 BooleanType t = bool();

    Restrictions on this type

    This type allows you to impose following restrictions on the value space.

    1. enumeration
    2. assertion

    1. enumeration

    enumeration specifies the value space of this type as a set of distinct values.

    bool().enumeration(true);

    2. assertion

    assertion allows you to make a arbitrary assertion on the values of this type.

    See Also:
    SchemaComponents

      • assertion

        BooleanType assertion(Predicate<JsonValue> predicate,
                      ProblemDescriber<JsonValue> describer)
        Makes a assertion on the values of this type.
        Parameters:
        predicate - the lambda expression that will return true if the assertion succeeded or false if failed.
        describer - the object supplying the description of the problem to be reported when the assertion failed.
        Returns:
        this type.
        Throws:
        SchemaException - if any of specified parameters is null.
